sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph G:

```
   A --- B
   |     |
   C --- D
```

What is the chromatic index χ'(G) of the graph G?
message_2:
The chromatic index χ'(G) of a graph G is the minimum number of colors needed to color its edges such that no two adjacent edges share the same color.

In the given graph G, we can color the edges as follows:

```
   A --- B (color 1)
   |     |
   C --- D (color 1)
```

```
   A (color 2)
   |     
   C (color 2)
```

```
   B (color 3)
   |     
   D (color 3)
```

With this coloring, no two adjacent edges share the same color. Therefore, the chromatic index χ'(G) of the graph G is 3.
